Reviews.Content: This does not live up to the quality that Chef Garces demands in his restaurants.  First of all, I made my reservation a full month in advance of my trip.  I ended up having to wait over an hour to be seated because they never wrote my reservation down.  They suggested I may have missed up my dates when I booked, but I just don't understand how dates are mixed up on a 4 day trip.  The food was mediocre.  I have eaten at Amada and Trading Company in Philadelphia, and this place just doesn't compare.  I feel bad that the Chicagoans do not get to eat their native chef's best cuisine.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: We were a 6:30 Saturday night, pre-theater (Auditorium Theatre) 'walk-in' party of two and were lucky to get seats upstairs at the bar (the dimly lit first floor "lounge" seemed cozy but was already filled). Our bartenders (Bobby & Nicole?) were prompt without being pushy, worked well together (they both answered questions for us and made suggestions) and seemed genuinely friendly. The main dining room is grand without being 'stuffy' and had a good energy. We found this place thanks to Yelp but didn't leave hungry or feel shortchanged on the food as some other reviewers have. We had some  vegetarian dishes and both the prawns and the shrimp in garlic (what can I say? I'm crustacean crazy). My wife's final say on our meal; "If the food in Spain was this good I'd go back" (during a week in Seville she couldn't satisfy her radical veggie requirements).

Reviews.Author: Meggan R.
Reviews.Content: You have to get the tasting menu with the wine pairing.  Have one of the outrageous cocktails too.  The room is huge, table or booth both great.  Big open kitchen and fun staff. You will leave happy, full and with a smile on your face.  I would eat here once a week if I could afford it.

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Renaissance Blackstone on a business trip and this restaurant was in the hotel so I decided on a lazy night to give it a shot.  Some of the reviews on Yelp were pretty bad so I approached with caution. I have to say the reviews that call out the small plates and expensive prices were dead on. However, the quality of the food is absolutely outstanding. If you have a problem paying a premium for a smaller portions of amazing quality food then this isn't your place. I had the luxury of a business travel expense account which softened the blow. I ate at the bar two nights in a row and food price and size concerns aside, they have a kick ass bartender named Bobby who not only knows his stuff about the menu (everything he recommended was amazing), but made me a handful of drinks that were so far off the wall that I can't even remember what was in half of them. One had egg whites in it and was out of this freaking world. I don't give stars lightly but given the quality if the food, drinks, and recommendations and conversation from Bobby I have to give this place 4 stars.The complaints about it being too dark to see are silly.  It has the right ambiance for a restaurant of this type and caliber.

Reviews.Author: bj f.
Reviews.Content: i loved this place! climbing the stairs into the creatively designed, wide open space makes for a entrance that speaks attitude, but the friendly greeter dispelled that fear, as we were seated to begin a meal as unique as the surroundings. our server was upbeat and helpful with suggestions, a really pleasant guy.my hub is an absinthe afficionado, and enjoyed one of three offered while i savored their take on sangria via a sangriatini, a blend of red wine, brandy, cava and fruit, which was absolutely delicious. the first course was a perfectly dressed salad with asparagus, followed by a clam and bacon flatbread that was unlike anything we'd ever tasted. we chose our tapas from the specialty sections, the duck with confit and fois gras, and the lobster in butter sauce with flan. a listing of ingredients doesn't reflect the artfully presented, wonderful flavors of each serving, and as small as tapas are, we were really stuffed. one surprising perk was provided by the gentleman seated on the bench to my left. he had ordered a tasting dinner, and had about four plates before him when we arrived. while we began enjoying our dinner, they brought out a spinach dish, ribs, and a lamb chop. he groaned that he couldn't possibly eat another bite, but was persuaded by his server to try at least one. he reached over, grabbed the platter of spinach (deliciously prepared with pine nuts and fruit) and the lamb chop, and handed them to me, insisting that they would be wasted if i didn't accept his offerings. oh no, twist my arm some more... we loved the spinach, but discovered that we couldn't eat another forkful ourselves, so we had the lamb chop packed to go. it was altogether one of the best dinners, and tastiest, most original tapas we've ever enjoyed. the only reason i held back a star was the cost. i'd suggest that you take advantage of the tasting menu, because with drinks included, our few dishes well exceeded the cost of that option. and though you'll be too full to finish, you'll be guaranteed some tasty snacks for a day or two.

Reviews.Author: Hayden B.
Reviews.Content: We were in from out of town & staying at the Blackstone so the Mercat was the obvious place for drinks before going out on several occasions. The bartenders were the friendliest in town, literally the nicest people we met while on vacation. They have some fantastic specialty drinks and I fell in love with the sangria (AND it's less than $2 a glass on Monday nights)! Unfortunately we did not eat during our stay so I can only comment on the drinks; however, the food did smell amazing!

Reviews.Author: Tiff H.
Reviews.Content: First ballet in the "big city!" Ballet to see at 7:30...may get hungry before the show...what to do what to do. Google location of the the auditorium...google restaurants within walking distance....less than .1 mile please....my feet will be on fire when walking more than that in heels.Results: Mercat a la Planxa. Reviews: Average  4 stars. Ding ding...we have a winner! Reservations for 5:30pm...a little "snack" before going to the ballet.I walk in a bit early because I wanted to tell the server that we have to make the ballet. Hate rushing dinner, but my nightmares of the Joffrey usher slamming the doors in my group's face because we arrived at 7:31pm were just too vivid.The waitress was very knowledgeable and very nice. However, my alarm bells went off because she suggested the Chef Selection for the group because that'd make it easy. I didn't want too...$58 was already $15 more than I wanted to spend on actual food....but, had to...EVERYONE at the table is required if anyone wants to do the chef selection.Ok, fine. I'll do it. Experience right? Splurge. A plus...they accommodated for the vegetarians at the table and brought out some fantastic veggie side dishes when the rest of us had meat.What do I remember that was good? The little chili pepper dipped in mayo sauce was tasty. The lamb was excellent. The veggie dishes that had Murielles (spelling?) were awesome...I adore those mushrooms tho...best fungus of all. The beef...I got stuck with a butt piece so I didn't get to taste the pieces that were cooked rare...I like my meat bloody. I guess it may have been good...I did stare longingly at the red red pieces, but the little piggy in me said to share. The chef brought out some "complimentary" tator tot things topped with spicy mayo...fine, but they showed up on our table again. Seriously? If it's complimentary, send a salad or something...something we won't see again! Bacon wrapped dates...bacon was seared and way blacker than I like...if that's possible. Oh the prawns...the size of my hand (literally...I have small hands) and the heads were still attached! My Chinese self squealed with delight...too bad I wasn't comfy enough around my party to ask for their prawn heads so I could eat the brains. I think I grossed out the vegetarians that surrounded me. Sorry! That's pretty much all I can remember....Chef Selection didn't include dessert. :(As with any large party, there was some discrepancy over the bill, but the waitress was nice about it. I was more embarrassed than anything. Charged a 19% gratuity...that was fine..we had table of 7 and I thought it'd be more along the lines of 20%. The waitress did a great job bringing the bill when I asked for it, and we split it among several cards. Tip: Ask your server for a pen and piece of paper so you can write down the appropriate amounts for each card...make the server's life easy. A+ to Mercat for accommodating. At the end of the day, for me alone, tip+tax+food, I was at $83...I kept having to tell myself...it's a special occasion. We ran a bit late and weren't out of there by 7pm like I wanted but no biggie.Bottom line: I need a side job here. $100 for a table of 7 when I hardly did anything? Jeez, I wish I had food runners, bus boys, water refillers when I was a waitress!!! The food was good...small portions, but there are tapas places that are more worth the $. Come here for a splurge or special occasion or when a rich relative is paying. I saw no other Asians there...they probably knew better! I left hungry...went to Ping Pong later for calamari (yum yum). Oh yeah, set aside 2 hours for dinner...great rule of thumb. Good food, but you pay for the experience more. Everyone else loved it. I would have too, if the hole in my wallet wasn't screaming at me...if I had left full, I think it wouldn't have been yelling quite as loud.PS. We did get out in time, and my feet needed a cab. Yes, I was a lazy person and took a cab 4 blocks. By the time it was time to go out and get "crazy"....my feet didn't allow me to. I'm never wearing heels again.

Reviews.Author: L L.
Reviews.Content: I am a salty girl, I'd rather have a grilled cheese and bacon or a meaty entree over dessert, but for restaurant week, I met the best dessert of my life! Chocolate croquettes, in rosemary caramel, olive oil and banana marshmallow!!!! HELLO ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME?!?!?! It was every bit if not more amazing than it sounds. Will be going back for more than dessert, but that's all I can write about for now.

Reviews.Author: Poof A.
Reviews.Content: Service matters.As everybody else has said, the food here is fantastic. I went with a group of friends during Restaurant Week and shared a bunch of Prix Fixe menus. Delicious cheese plate; mushroom soup was AMAZING; loved the salad; desserts were all top-notch (maybe too rich after all the delicious food!) I can't comment on the meat/seafood items but everybody seemed pleased (I think they had scallops, short ribs, and a few other things)The problem was with our waiter. We were a group of 20-something grad students out for a prix fixe- maybe he assumed we would be bad tippers? In any case, he seemed very frazzled and inattentive. My salad didn't come for close to 20 minutes, at which point I had to flag down a bus boy to ask for it. Nonetheless, I worked in the food service industry for long enough that I tip 20% standard unless something is *really* wrong. So I did. We had spread the tab equally across 5 credit cards; I quietly tipped a couple dollars more than the others (who, it should be noted, were all tipping at least 15%). At the end of the meal, our waiter came to the table where he blatantly read our credit cards slips RIGHT IN FRONT OF US. ummm what? I'm no Emily Post, but that is some bad etiquette. He then said, very pointedly, "thank you [my name]" to me alone, and left. Last I checked, you thank people for patronizing your restaurant when they could have chosen to go any number of places, NOT because you consider their tip sufficient for your (frankly sub-par) service.Again, the food was delicious, but the service left a bad taste in my mouth. I will not be back.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to celebrate my birthday here. My boyfriend took me and a few friends for a little surprise birthday dinner. I loved the environment... totally upscale and trendy but not overwhelming. (I wasn't dressed very nice but didn't feel out of place at all.) It is tapas, but fancier than most, and tastier than most. We ordered about 2-3 tapas a person and we were so full by the end of the night. I can't even remember everything we ordered but some of my favorites were the beef shortrib flatbread and the shortribs and diver scallops. The bruscetta-type opener they brought out was really tasty, too. Overall, the dishes were very unique, tasty and nicely presented. We also had the pear sangria which was delicious! I would definitely recommend Mercat for a special night out. It is pricier than the typical tapas place but well worth it for the quality of food!

Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful food, decent decor, better than average service.  Mercat has some of the most flavorful foods I've ever eaten.  The bacon-wrapped dates are amazing.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: Went with friends on a Sat night. Though we had a reservation, we were seated 30 mins after we arrived ( they offered us a drink). Food is just ok, but the presentation is great. If you want better food with ambiance, go to Avec. If you want better food, go to Tapas Barcelona in Evanston.

Reviews.Author: Tuba M.
Reviews.Content: Drinks rock!!! try the pinapple mojito... to die for... also the brunch is amazing... $25 for four tapas and bottomless drinks - cant beat that

Reviews.Author: Dina L.
Reviews.Content: Good Spanish cuisine. Every time I've been here, it has been with a big group and we shared everything, which is the way to go.

Reviews.Author: nancy b.
Reviews.Content: i was lucky enough to attend a magazine event here around the time that they opened.  whenever i go to these free events i expect some decent fare, but mercat blew me away.  it's a great spot for large groups (i send work folks here a lot), but be prepared to dish out some good money - not that it's not worth it.  must-eats:  lamb chops, short ribs and setas del horno.  service is good, nothing stellar but nothing bad.  the bartenders are all very friendly and had good recommendations while i was waiting (including making me something to taste that wasn't on the menu).  the decor is amazing and makes for a very fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Marisa S.
Reviews.Content: Tried Mercat a la Planxa during restaurant week for lunch and was pleasantly surprised!  Lunch is a great value, the catalan express (2 courses and soda for $18 or $22) is pretty filling even though it's a tapas restaurant.  Go with a group of people and share the courses so you can try everything!  My favorite so far, the mushroom soup!

Reviews.Author: Tina K.
Reviews.Content: Been to Mercat several times for both lunch and dinner.  Every time I've been there, the service has been warm and friendly and the food has been excellent.  Love the sangria.  Also love the decor and atmosphere... fun, trendy and inviting.

Reviews.Author: Jill P.
Reviews.Content: This place is just OK.  I would suggest Carnivale, BabaReeba, Iberico, or Meza over this place anytime.

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: Ate here for brunch with a group of friends. The restaurant itself is gorgeous!!! The service is fantastic. The drink menu is different and interesting in a good way....I had the Horchata Spike and it was DELICIOUS! The food was tasty but a bit cold when it came out....this is the reason I gave Mercat 3 stars as opposed to 4. One thing is for sure, I will be coming here again! Thank you Iron Chef Jose Garces

Reviews.Author: Donisha L.
Reviews.Content: I really don't know how to feel about this start to my restaurant week. Presidents Day off = taking advantage of a stress free Monday by consuming lots of calories. Instead this was a stress filled dining experience. My friend and I, walked in today at lunch about 12:15pm and were pleasantly surprised to see very few patrons. Not completely empty but not obnoxiously crowded, CHITOWN LUNCH SUCCESS!     We are seated immediately. We chat, scan the menu, chat some more ... Ok where is the waiter? 15 minutes later he rushes to our table, pen and pad in hand, "What would you like?" Ummmm...ok. An explanation of your menu would be nice, maybe even a recommendation or two? After prompting, He explained that Mercat's restaurant week menu was the regular Catalan Express menu For $18 (we soon learn there would be nothing express about this meal),  which included one choice from a list of options under 1st course and 2nd course. Dessert could be included for $22. We order a few glasses of wine first and he immediately walks away from the table to put in the drink order. Probably would have been more time efficient to put in everything together, but whatever. At this point we just want to get the ball rolling, it's now 12:35pm. To start, we have the Arroz a la Cazuela (essentially a spicy soup reminiscent of gumbo) and Ensalada Verde (simple salad). Second course, We order the Mercat Burger and Barri Gotic ( hanger steak).     We sip, we chat, we sip some more. It's 12:50pm and still no first course. Ooooooook. We stop a busser and request our waiter. We sip, we chat....we then watch the table next to us receive their 1st course. It's now 1:00pm. But we were seated and ordered before them, what's the issue?!?! We stop another person walking around "hi, we've been waiting for our food...hmmm... FOREVER, can we speak to our waiter to see what's the hold up?".  They come back and say it's coming right out and drop complimentary peppers on our table. I don't want your peppers señor, I want WHAT I ORDERED. And I want you to apologize because the reality is, you forgot to enter our order. I'm no fool. Things started picking up a little after we walked in and you were overwhelmed, just say it!!!!     Finally we get our first course: a salad and soup. didn't realize salad and soup took 40  minutes to prepare. Did you pick this fresh from the lettuce farm? Was the soup flown in from some foreign country prior to? So confused. We annihilate the soup and salad.WAITER: "would you like us to get your 2nd course started" US: "Hell Yea?!"     We received our 2nd course shortly thereafter, thank God. It is now 1:40pm. The waiter comes back to the table and asks if we would like to try dessert. I ask if it will take long? He laughs. I straight face him. It takes everything in me not to say, "I'm f***ing serious, is it going to take you another hour or can you make it quick". We decide not to risk it, pay immediately and leave. It's now 1:55pm.     I'm not a fan of two hour lunches, servers neglecting tables, and overall "so-so" dining experiences. The food was pretty tasty but overshadowed by the service. Sorry Mercat, I probably won't be back unless I have a bag of snacks in my purse and 4 hours to spare.

Reviews.Author: Jango O.
Reviews.Content: Came here with 2 others and had the chef's choice deluxe ($85 per).  If you can afford it this is the way to go.  The food was excellent.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A.
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Mercat for Iron Chef Garces book debut dinner.  OMG delicious!  Every course was a recipe out if his new book that modernizes Latin foods. Chef Garces was a super nice host for the evening to boot!

Reviews.Author: Kin L.
Reviews.Content: Was not impressed by the restaurant. The server explained the menu but failed to mention that they had a special menu for Chef's Week. After asking about it, he noted they don't bring it up until a customer asks for it. The menu is very pricey (for tapas) and they have a lot of tourist that come there, but I think to not mention it is disingenuous. The server cleared our table a few times (other servers did also) and saw our drinks were empty and did not ask if we wanted more. He did close to the end of the meal, but our drinks were probably empty for close to 30 minutes. The food was good but the reason I gave it a Fair grade is that I ended up with food poisoning and my date also felt ill overnight though not as bad.

Reviews.Author: Jeff M.
Reviews.Content: Very excelent food and a good wine to boot.  the bacon wrapped dates were a huge hit. They did a good job spacing the dishes over time.  But for four people, the price was in excess if $300, a bit steep making this a special occasion only place

Reviews.Author: Leang E.
Reviews.Content: I came here with an old coworker for lunch and was a little surprised by how few people were in here. We got in a little after noonish, and you get a view of the bar right as you come in. This area seems to be nice for those that are dining by themselves or with one other person for a quiet quick bite. You go up the stairs for the main dining area, which is very open and spacious. We came for Chef's Week, but there was no special menu. We got the regular choice of the lunch options that they have available La Mesa de Jose where the chef creates his own special tapas menu for you or The Catalan Express where you get a choice of 2 options. I was pretty disappointed by this because we could have come any other day for this. It was misleading as the restaurant didn't specify that they were doing Chef's Week only for dinner here or I just made assumptions that they would have a special menu. In any case we shared the Spanish omelette and the croquetas. The portion of the croquetas were really small. I had the salmon as my second and that was the item I probably enjoyed the most. The patatas bravas were french fries with the spicy orange sauce that was not spicy at all. We also split the hazelnut mascarpone gateau with apricots. I would have liked to have tried more and would have liked a full menu of options I feel tainted and dissuaded to come back and try again. The prices were average and the service was ok.

Reviews.Author: Jason F.
Reviews.Content: For a restaurant situated on Michigan Ave, land of every tourist that comes to Chicago - this place was right on for tapas. great menu. great drink selections, great staff. Order the tapas: Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Wrapped Stuffed Dates w/ Almonds were awesome. Spanish Omellette needed some help but everything else was awesome. Spicy Potatoes were great too!

Reviews.Author: Marti G.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome!!! The food was amazing. The sangria could use some work though...overall the servers really took customer service to the next level, they all new their stuff and really got everyone involved in the food. I will certainly try this place again!

Reviews.Author: Marcos L.
Reviews.Content: Tasty bar treats. Very swank. Euro-swank. Not bad if you want a little indulgence. Don't over-extend your expectations, and everyone will be happy.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: Mercat is a beautiful restaurant serving expensive tapas. The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous with a lot of fun artwork, colors and mirrors surrounding its walls. The tapas were good but I think I can eat much better tasting tapas at Emilio's for 1/2 the price and double the portion. My friend and I ordered bacon wrapped dates, seafood skewers and a cheese plate. The combination of bacon wrapped dates always taste heavenly no matter where you order it from but you have the urge to order another one upon discovering there were only about 4 pieces sitting on the plate. Seafood skewer was great in terms of sauce that accompanied it and cheese plate was fine as well. Drinks were a bit weak and service a-okay,

Reviews.Author: Dallas T.
Reviews.Content: It was OK but not spectacular, as most reviews suggest. Great service, and it seems like a great hotel. I want for lunch, and I will say it was on the heavy side. Gobs of mayonnaise on my sandwich, dons of dressing on my salad. Was too much for me. Maybe dinner is better...

Reviews.Author: amanda g.
Reviews.Content: The waitress was very knowledgeable and very nice. However, my alarm bells went off because she suggested the Chef Selection for the group because that'd make it easy. I didn't want too...$58 was already $15 more than I wanted to spend on actual food....but, had to...EVERYONE at the table is required if anyone wants to do the chef selection.Ok, fine. I'll do it. Experience right? Splurge. A plus...they accommodated for the vegetarians at the table and brought out some fantastic veggie side dishes when the rest of us had meat.What do I remember that was good? The little chili pepper dipped in mayo sauce was tasty. The lamb was excellent. The veggie dishes that had Murielles (spelling?) were awesome...I adore those mushrooms tho...best fungus of all. The beef...I got stuck with a butt piece so I didn't get to taste the pieces that were cooked rare...I like my meat bloody. I guess it may have been good...I did stare longingly at the red red pieces, but the little piggy in me said to share. The chef brought out some "complimentary" tator tot things topped with spicy mayo...fine, but they showed up on our table again. Seriously? If it's complimentary, send a salad or something...something we won't see again! Bacon wrapped dates...bacon was seared and way blacker than I like...if that's possible. Oh the prawns...the size of my hand (literally...I have small hands) and the heads were still attached! My Chinese self squealed with delight...too bad I wasn't comfy enough around my party to ask for their prawn heads so I could eat the brains. I think I grossed out the vegetarians that surrounded me. Sorry! That's pretty much all I can remember....Chef Selection didn't include dessert. :(

Reviews.Author: Lori R.
Reviews.Content: YUM! This is one of my favorite spots! Bacon wrapped dates, muddled strawberry drink is to die for! It's a bit pricey but worth it. Also, the complimentary bread is delish! Love this place and highly recommend it for tapas and a fun time in Chicago! :)

Reviews.Author: Edward M.
Reviews.Content: i really liked this place. a great place for a nice night out with friends or a datewent with a group of friends for dinner. we ordered just about everything on the menu, but i wont list it all off. among the highlights were the short rib + scallop (flavor explosion), mushroom risotto, and octopus. but really i thought everything was great except for the cauliflower (psh vegetables...).and i'm usually not into cocktails, but after a strong recommendation from the server i got the cha cha, which was great as well. we ended up getting a few pitchers of sangria toothe restaurant space itself is pretty cool; nice design and a lot of open space. the restaurant was full and had a nice, lively energy about it. made you really feel like you were out and part of the city, if that makes any sensethe service was good; attentive, friendly and helpful. the only real issue i have is that it's a bit too expensive to go to on a regular basis. each dish is around $12 each. add in the drinks, which was half our tab; i paid about $100 for the night. worth it for a nicer night out with the buddies, but just a bit unsustainable. which is too bad because i'd love to come back often

Reviews.Author: Katie G.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten here several times and each time have really enjoyed myself.  I love the wine list.  Several good, reasonably priced options.  I have also had the sangria which is also quite good.  Some favorites of mine:  bacon wrapped dates, all of their salads, lamb chops, flatbreads, and the pork belly.  A bit pricier than Iberico or BabaReeba but much better in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Jared J.
Reviews.Content: I thought it could have been better

Reviews.Author: Christine W.
Reviews.Content: Lovely small plates that have great interest and flair.

Reviews.Author: Trudy T.
Reviews.Content: Love the ambiance! If you don't eat beef or pork, then u have a very limited selection of dishes to choose to from, however, the garlic shrimp are very good. For those who don't know, (I just found out at the restaurant) Tapa means small plate. Therefore you have to order at least 3-4 plates to get the equivalent of a regular meal. The potatoes are great (basically smooth tater tots with spicy cheese) and the bread they serve is divine! Overall, I love the place, but it is not a place to go when you are starving, because it can be on the pricey side.

Reviews.Author: Shalin D.
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about what I wear to restaurants. If it's Italian, I like dressing up, something tailored by a Milanese man perhaps. If it's Indian, I throw on a tunic and a shawl. If it's Mexican, I won't go so far as to wear a sombrero, but a little color never hurt anyone. So, when I went to Mercat dressed up like a flamenco dancer, I felt like a complete moron. The restaurant was dressed up enough. It needed little help from me or my ruffled shirt. The layout is a big oval with festive-colored walls and deep shades of fuchsia, red, and orange everywhere. The decor a nice complement to the somewhat-dim lighting and somewhat-sophisticated clientele. Needless to say, this is not the place to dress up like a cultural stereotype. Leave the fringe at home.Thankfully, the food distracted me from feeling too self-conscience.This is to say: the food is incredibly good and you really can't stop eating. Instead of navigating the menu ourselves, we (all eight of us in the group) ordered the six course tasting with the wine pairing. It was a smart move. We started with a creamy manchego and honey. The cheese was smoother than most manchegos I've tasted with a slight nuttiness that paired well with the cloyingly sweet honey. We then moved on to a sizzling shrimp that I didn't care too much for (the shrimp smelled fishy - never a good sign). We were then given a salad tossed in an excellent vinaigrette which was wrapped in a casing of serrano ham. It was perfect. Unlike most salads, this one was substantial in volume and taste. The vinegar in the dressing cut the fattiness of the serrano in just the right way. Next course: patatas bravas. These were served in single servings with a great spice paste resting on top. We were also brought a lamb dish and bacon-wrapped dates that were to die for. All in all: an excellent meal.Two complaints: First, we made a reservation two weeks in advance and still had to wait forty-five minutes before we were seated. Second, the wine portions in the pairing are bit austere. If I'm paying an additional $40 for wine, I want to get a bottle's worth. Not that I'm a lush or anything.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: caroline k.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Sunday for their tasting menu, showed up with no reservation at noon for 2 and was seated quickly as the place was rather empty.  The menu is comprised of ~8 tasting dishes plus the carving station (suckling pig), charcuterie table (3 cheese, 3 meats) and 'bottomless' dessert table (nothing extraordinary).   The served dishes themselves are remarkable - the bacon-wrapped dates with almonds, which i've had before elsewhere were out of this world.  Heated to just the right temperature and served over a light salad with blue cheese dressing.   Other courses included mussels, buckwheat pancakes, poached eggs... all very flavorful and tasty.  Portions on the smaller side.  Decor is rather bland but I could imagine the place lights up better at night.

Reviews.Author: Bryan M.
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor, for the love of everything good in life.  Just beyond any useful description.

Reviews.Author: Eric F.
Reviews.Content: We came here for an anniversary dinner a while ago with big hopes but received mediocrity. We frequent Tapas Valencia and have ventured out to Ba Ba Reeba so we were familiar with tapas bars. We'd heard great things about Mercat so we went in with high expectations. All of the workers were nice, the host sat us immediately and, when he was around, the server was friendly. We found the food to be nothing special and the portions small, even for tapas. It wasn't a bad experience, just nothing stood out.

Reviews.Author: Kevin D.
Reviews.Content: Lovely atmosphere, incredible tapas, wish I could try them all but will be back again!!

Reviews.Author: Sam W.
Reviews.Content: "One of the best meals I've ever had in my entire life."That was what my dining companion said halfway through our meal (even before dessert).  Mercat a la Planxa has been a must-try for me the past two years and I finally found the perfect time to try it out.  We made a 12:15pm reservation for lunch and were seated immediately next to giant window overlooking Michigan Ave.  The dining room has a high ceiling with mirrors on both sides with painted birds on them.  Very decorative and trendy.  The tables near the outside of the restaurant can be close together (probably during busy times the two-tops can be frustratingly close) but for the most part are well spaced out.  Our server was very professional and mentioned he also worked at Smith & Woolsensky's, so you knew he knew his stuff.For lunch, Mercat offers an $18 per person Catalan Lunch, where you choose one item from the list of First Courses and one item from the list of Second Courses.I chose the Serrano Ham & Fig Salad and my companion chose the Pimentos de Padron.  The salad was huge  (check the photo uploaded) and filled with fresh figs, some type of fancy blue cheese, and tossed with a sherry vinaigrette.  Any salad using spinach leaves is always good, and other than maybe a tad too much dressing, this one was great.  The Pimentos de Padron, which were fried pimento peppers, were very tasty and had just the slightest crisp to them and a hint of spice.  The thick specks of sea salt made them eve more enjoyable.For our Second Courses, we chose the Black Angus Hangar Steak and the Vieires i Albergínia (grilled diver scallops).  The steak was ordered medium rare and came out close to rare, but it wasn't a major concern.  The steak came topped with fresh beech mushrooms and was served on a thin layer of short ribs and a thick potato croquette.  The croquette tasted like a fancy hash brown and was perfectly crispy on the outside and moist in the inside.  One of the best dishes I've ever had.  The scallops were flawless as well.  Four giant diver scallops a la planxa (on the grill) were cooked to perfection and almost melted in your mouth.  They are served on two wooden skewers and come with an addicting roasted eggplant puree and a confit of artichokes.  Muy delicioso!All items on the menu can be orded a la carte, so we decided to try a side order of the Setas al Horno (wild mushrooms, potatoes, parsley, and shallots). It was served sizzling hot in a mini black cast iron skillet.  If you order one thing at Mercat a la Planxa, make sure it is these mushrooms. Unbelievable flavor and if this was served in a giant bucket, I would have no problem finishing it.For dessert we ordered both available options: the Pastissos D'avellana (Hazelnut-Mascarpone Gateaux, Apricot, Dulche de Leche, Salted Hazelnuts) and the Croquetas de Xocolata(Milk Chocolate Croquettes, Banana Marshmallow, Rosemary Caramel, Arbequina Olive Oil). I gave the full descriptions because they read exactly as they taste. We destroyed both of them and left no sauce or crumbs on the plate. (check the photos to see how they are composed)I can't wait to return here for dinner one night and try the rest of their items. Do yourself a favor and stop in Mercat a la Palnxa and if you follow my ordering advice, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Grant C.
Reviews.Content: We went here on the day before New Year's and splurged on the Chef's Luxury Tasting Menu with wine flight for 2 at $135 apiece. (That was done largely because we hadn't tried anything there before and wanted to get immersed in the full dining experience.) The interior design of this place is quite magnificent to behold. Our server was super attentive, and even gave us both an extra glass of wine for our final item not coming out with the rest of the 3rd course. (We received 12 plates total for 3 courses.) It probably did help a lot that we arrived for early seating, too. My biggest pleasant surprise were how well the exotic mushrooms tasted just by themselves (and I'm normally not a fan of mushrooms by themselves). We would certainly come back here again when staying downtown, and next time just to try out a few individual items on the menu. (Of course it is pricey, so plan to save up!)

Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: Nice menu, nice environment, good food.  I recommend for a fun evening of Spanish Tapas.

Reviews.Author: Larry P.
Reviews.Content: This was a real find.  Wonderful small plates.  A foodies paradise on S. Michigan Ave. Smoked quail with polenta was awesome. Butternut squash dumplings with lamb ragout - another great dish. Spinach a la catalina with currents pine nuts and apple was wonderful. Beef shorty rib flatbread - amazing. Chocolate croquettes with banana marshmallows - what a way to finish things off.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Flatbread w Sardines was unlike anything I've seen in a tapas place. Very very good. Peach infused vodka is great as well!

Reviews.Author: Joel W.
Reviews.Content: Was brought her by my mom, because it belongs to Iron Chef Jose Garces. Was not disappointed. I've had a variety of dishes at this fine establishment with my family and have not been disappointed. Everything is tasty and satisfying. Especially love the meat dishes like the Wagyu Zabuton, Iberico Secreto, and the Cordero. Would recommend this to anyone who is visiting Chicago or lives there.

Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if we hit a bad night, but of all we ordered, 80% was way over cooked. The bacon wrapped dates, the spicy potatoes, and the pork belly Wes so over cooked and dry, we couldn't finish any of them. My favorite dish we had was the halibut which was cooked nicely and had good flavor. I have to agree with other Yelpers that it was very loud, but the place is beautifully decorated. . We tried the red and white sangria, which were not good enough to order again, so we switched to wine. But the spicy potatoes ( which for me were like bad tater tots) and dry, over cooked dates did this place in for me. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: LARRY k.
Reviews.Content: I became a huge fan of this place after just one visit. Its a Catalan tapas restaurant operated by iron chef Jose Garces. The atmosphere is a quiet, subduded and elegant. The four of us shared about 5-6 courses all of which were excellent.  The price including drinks and a tip was around $200.00 which I think is a bargain for a restaurant of this quality.

Reviews.Author: Peter M.
Reviews.Content: We went to mercat last night after we had dinner at home. We wanted dessert and a drink a decided the short bike ride to mercat would be worth while. Our waiter was nice at first. We ordered two drinks and a cheese plate. Later we mentioned we would like to see a dessert menu, that is when the service essentially stopped. He dropped off the menu then didn't check back for about a half hour. He walked past our table multiple times and didn't pay any attention. Finally he stopped by to take the dessert order. He never asked how it was, in fact he never came back to the table. Our dessert, check, and receipt all brought by a different person. When we were leaving my girlfriend said "thanks, bye". He didn't respond and kept walking. I understand our check total was only around $60 but that doesn't mean we should be ignored. Won't be going there again.

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: I went here with a group of girls and we had the Chef's tasting menu with the wine pairing. It was amazing! I love the decor, the wine list and for $75 you get plenty of food and wine! They recently added outdoor seating off the bar on Michigan Ave. and it's just a great place to have a drink and people watch. I'll be going back soon!

Reviews.Author: Ellen A.
Reviews.Content: Warning: Huge!  Loud!  If you're looking for something intimate, this is not it!  Half the tables seem to be groups that insisted the server take pictures of them.  Seriously so very loud: with kind of loud techno music playing loudly, and two stories of space above the loud crowd for noise to loudly reverberate around.  Also, really big!  Not lettuce entertain you big, but it sort of still felt that way.A note about the space: the dining room has enormous arched windows that face east onto Michigan, so the room is flooded with that orange sodium light.  (A plus in my book.)  Also, there are several bar / lounge areas to wait in, with lots of nooks for chatting with a small group. So if you're up for a kind of big restaurant experience: the food is fantastic.  (The normal small-plate place caveats apply here.  It's probably more fun with more people because you can taste more things, it can probably get quite expensive in that way, etc.)  Since we were only two, we did the tasting menu.  It was... well, tasty, but they don't give you much of the distinctive food, and the portions were really too big.  My favorite part was the wine pairings; there were three, and they were all really interesting and/or delicious.  (I asked for a list of the choices and our server forgot it.)The wee tater tots (patatas bravas?) with spicy aioli are great.  The grilled scallops were good, but crazy salty.  The flatbread was flavorful and complex.  Octopus was outstanding - tender and spiced in a really nice, balanced way.I will happily go back if a group of friends suggests it.

Reviews.Author: Eric R.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmm...love it.

Reviews.Author: Noel K.
Reviews.Content: Nice place with  great presentation.  We were there for lunch. Had the apple pork sausage with beans, croquetas (deep fried breaded fish shaped in marble sized balls), grits with shrimp and short ribs and a cheese platter.

Reviews.Author: Mercedes S.
Reviews.Content: I scheduled this lunch with a few co-workers and it was a new place for all of us.  We all tried a different dish and everyone seemed to like it.  I had the Hanger Steak and it was delicous as well as the Ensalada Verde.  I would totally go again but this time for dinner and would love to try the place for breakfast as well.  The environment is very clean and colorful.  Staff was very welcoming and quick to our needs.

Reviews.Author: Brian P.
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend dining here. If it were only a matter of the food, my rec would probably be to give it a shot. In fact, we had a number of very tasty dishes. The short rib flat bread, pork belly, mushrooms, and black lentil concoction were all stand-outs. The starter meat plate was very weak (they choose three jamons or something similar for you - none was particularly good); the halibut was not that flavorful nor were the mussels. We did enjoy the desserts a lot. Terrible brewed coffee; the Golden Nugget's is better.However....as a dining experience I wanted to get the hell out of there as quickly as possible, as did everyone at the table. A lot of things to note: * It was a very rainy night and generally S Michigan Ave is a dumpy location for a nice restaurant (maybe all the tourists around don't know better) but no valet parking that we could identify; in retrospect maybe the Blackstone hotel (where it's located) had it but the point is it wasn't in front of the restaurant and we circled for street parking. * As several other reviewers noted, it was way too noisy and pounding house music wore us down through the evening (I actually like house music when it's a great mix; this was really generic). The place was the opposite of hip (if that's what they were going for): it was mostly older couples (guilty!) and a bunch of tourists in shorts and golf shirts (at 8pm on a Saturday, I just don't get that) who probably stumbled over from the Hilton & Towers next door.* The menu was really hard to figure out. I mean, really confusing. Hard to describe without actually seeing it and then having it explained for 10 minutes. Supposedly "everything" was small plate and there was supposed to be some sort of progression (we were told three stages, but nothing on the menu would suggest that), but then you had meats at 3-4 different parts of the menu and generally the price range on these small plates was massive, ranging from ~ $6 to ~ $50. We got it but it took too long. It also led to other problems....* The service was very mixed. Oddly the restaurant had very few bus boys so it was our server who was always filling our waters. More importantly, we had dirty plates and silverware (this is small plate tapas with lots of different flavors/sauces coming at us) sitting in front of us with no one coming by for more than 10-15 minutes. At one point I insisted on a clean plate and the helper we found brought just one for me and not the others at the table. Re the menu-related issues, we ordered WAY too much because our server pushed more and more food. Not having any sense from the menu of sizing, we ordered a ton and somewhat predictably walked out too stuffed. She seemed to be going by a script that we had to order a certain amount of food at each stage and was a bit aggressive about it. Most aggravating, she kept pushing that we order the $45 8 oz. wagyu beef dish or the $48 lamb chops (four small chops), which by the way were listed up near the small starters and not near the mains at the bottom (?). If she tried to up-sell it once, but it was more than once and as our wives noted, it was all too pushy.For a bunch of reasons, don't eat here.

Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: Holy crap is this place amazing!  The waiter recommended the lamb chops and it came with these two great sauces on the side. The chops were so good I didn't even want to use the sauce but then I felt bad because the sauce was so good! So we ordered another round of chops! Unbelievable! The lamb chops are expensive ($48 for 4) but so damn worth it! Everything else we had was great with the exception of the paella which the rice seemed a bit overcooked.  Scallops were amazing! They even brought a few items out for free which was a nice thing. Very expensive place but worth every penny. Mmmmmmmmmmmmm....

Reviews.Author: Henry C.
Reviews.Content: We were excited after reading stellar reviews about this Iron Chef owned restaurant. We had selected this restaurant since it claims to be the only Catalan tapas restaurant in the city...Mercat a la Planxa does not serve what the other Tapas restaurant in the city have - in fact, we were very impressed with the flavor and presentation of each and every one of them. 4 stars for the food. However, we were utterly unimpressed with the service. I can understand a laid back style to service or I can understand if the server is busy with a full dining room. However, when neither is the case and when you are paying a relatively higher premium for the food, the expectation is elevated.As a result, I will not be returninig soon.

Reviews.Author: Luci L.
Reviews.Content: Unusual, tasty food. I didn't have my socks blown off by the sheer awesomeness of the food, but they were adventurous in flavor combinations and the quality was very good. Unpretentious service, fun and hip atmosphere. We had bacon-wrapped dates (yummy), warm green bean salad (yummy), goat cheese with garlic sauce (yummy yummy) and a sausage pizza thingy (not so yummy). The dessert (chocolate croquettes with banana infused marshmallow) was the reason we came in the first place and it was tasty and different, bordering on delicious but stopped right on the edge of yummy. Come with middling expectations and your tastebuds will be very happy indeed!

Reviews.Author: Nora N.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Great food, service and ambiance.  Highly recommend it to those visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I just had to high of expectations or what, but this was just a very trendy place with trendy food that wasn't anything special.Its possible that I didn't order correctly, but I wasn't blown away by anything.We didn't want to eat much before going out, so we just ordered a few small plates to split...service was outstanding though.

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Iron Chef America and Jose Garces so I decided to check this place out. Very impressed! Besides being a little on the pricey end, you get what you pay for. It is one of the best Spanish restaurants in the city. I recommend the braised short rib flatbread and the spinach was awesome too. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Piyush K.
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by the place. We came in early around 6. As its tapas, the portions are very small. But the food is pretty carefully prepared and is very flavorful. Spicy potatoes is highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Analicia E.
Reviews.Content: Good, food and fancy went there for my birthday. It was a special since I went right after chef Garces won the next Iron chef competiton.

Reviews.Author: david l.
Reviews.Content: Super! Amazing flavors and variety at dinner. Liked it so much that we went back for brunch the next morning.  Didn't disappoint with a cheese board and carving station to boot!

Reviews.Author: Sian C.
Reviews.Content: Best Spanish tapas I've ever had!  The view is lovely too at night.  Very romantic.

Reviews.Author: josie w.
Reviews.Content: Drinks are stiff-great pre-game place! This place Is better than Xocalo But wish they had carne asada...Don't stay too late tho becuz the crowd gets like most places @ closing time ;-)

Reviews.Author: Laura N.
Reviews.Content: The best meal of my life.  I recommend the chef's tasting and ask the waiter for a wine pairing recommendation. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Paul T.
Reviews.Content: Came here with some of my wife's clients for a night out.  Atmosphere is a nice blend between restaurant and lounge, and with the tapas menu, we were comfortable sipping and eating casually for over 3 hours.  A unique space for making a night of it, without stuffing yourself with too much rushed food.

Reviews.Author: R F.
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan Aveneu, and beautiful decor.  We were a medium sized group (6 people) and they were very accommodating.  Service was very good, providing interesting suggestions.  The food was very good, much of it excellent.  There was a type of after dinner port that was incredible, with a silky texture and tased of figs.

Reviews.Author: Stu S.
Reviews.Content: The food and ambiance here were amazing.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Every plate we had (and we had many) was great.  Favorites were the short rib flatbread, the prawns, and the braised rabbit agnolotti.  They offer a flight of all 3 sangria varietals as well, which is nice if you're having trouble making up your mind.

Reviews.Author: Eva J.
Reviews.Content: I am really not sure what to think about this place. You know, when you are perfectly balancing on the fence and not sure which side to swing to?I thought my husband described it very well: "Perfectly impersonal"The room is absolutely stunning. From the dramatically oversized windows, to the open kitchen and the honeycomb staircase. Quite impressive.Our server was very nice and knowledgeable. She explained the menu very well and answered our questions. But there was no personal touch, no connection. You can tell the company knows how to run a restaurant, the staff was well trained, things were done right but it felt a little mechanical.Food was a  hit or miss. Some things were delicious. My favorite was the American Wagu skirt stake. Perfectly seasoned. And unfortunately overcooked. We didn't get a chance to tell anyone about it -  a manager walked by but didn't stop and our server came by the table to bring our wine but didn't check on our food. And by the time I could open my mouth (which doesn't take that long, believe me) she had disappeared. Even so, the steak was very tender and delicious. The rabbit ravioli was super yummy too. The portions are small, so just get a few extra items. And seriously, what brainiac came up with a name that nobody can pronounce or remember? So you see what I mean? I'm still on that fence.

Reviews.Author: Leah A.
Reviews.Content: a few friends of mine work at this sprawling and awesome south loop hotel resto--and every time i go, they spoil me and i love it!!!!  the portions, for small plates, are great.  and the food and cocktails are absolutely stellar.  not to be missed:  the sangria (especially if they have the one with pomegranate), the short rib-scallop combo, the russian roulette peppers, and the melon soup with ricotta sorbet.  and the piece de resistance....the rabbit agnolotti, which is definitely in the top 5 dishes i have had the pleasure of eating. try it...i don't think it will disappoint.   ask to be seated in the lower part of the room, you get a great view of the park and you can still see the open kitchen.

Reviews.Author: jane r.
Reviews.Content: Mercat is a terrific place.  Wonderful fresh food, great tasting, nice place to bring friends.  Consistently good at dinner.  Once had a lunch that was not quite up to their great  quality which was disappointing as I brought an out of town friend there (I shared this on my next lunch there. The staff was very concerned and made sure that this experience was not repeated.)  One other negative is the music.  We brought a group there to enjoy the food...which we did...but the music was pounding and way too loud...we could neither hear each other nor the waitress.We loved the cheeses, breads, scallops, mushrooms, etc...and the presentation which is very pretty.  All in all, if the music problems are addressed this place will be perfect.

Reviews.Author: C M P.
Reviews.Content: Great place for a group. The upstairs Bartenders were great, friendly and informative as we waited for our group to assemble. You've got to try the bacon wrapped dates (we had seconds). I had the the avocado margarita and loved it. Many different tapas to chose. I say have at it and have fun discovering different tastes. It is pricey though. Upstairs is where to eat.

Reviews.Author: Jenn K.
Reviews.Content: I would give Mercat a la Planxa five stars for food & decor and three stars for service - so I compromised on an overall four.The food is amazing.  Every plate was delicious and worth every penny (it's pricey).  The portions aren't huge, which we love for tapas.  We were able to try lots of things without getting full.  The drinks were great, although on the expensive side.It also has a modern, unique, and bright aesthetic.  Lots of mirrors and colors.  We really enjoyed it.I'm going to quote two other reviews in saying the staff was "too cool for school" and "amateur".  The hostesses were downright rude.  Our server - who seemed inexperienced but was also nice, friendly, and funny - put in our order wrong and we were served in odd courses, with our intended appetizer coming after dessert.  We sent it back and they did not charge us for it, to their credit.Despite the flaws in the service, the food and overall experience were so great, we have recommended this restaurant to friends and plan to return ourselves.

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: One of the better tapas places in the city, though pricey. Drinks are tasty and interesting (had something involving avocados that actually worked, impressive stuff), food is great--nice mix of classic tapas and things i had never seen before, and the second floor dining area is outstanding--worth stopping in for a drink just to see that.

Reviews.Author: Kalli S.
Reviews.Content: oooh! do the tasting! yum yum yummy! i had a really great experience here all three times i have been. good service, inventive food and great drinks.i think the best route is the tasting because you get sort of a "greatest hits" of their tasty food. cool atmosphere too.

Reviews.Author: Ashish G.
Reviews.Content: I really like their take on tapas.  Although I love Cafe ba-ba-reba, this was a nice change of pace.  The portions are pretty small and dishes are pricey, so it is probably better suited for a special occasion rather than casual everyday dining.  My only qualm would be the service.  Our waiter was not very attentive nor friendly.  We described our likes, but yet he was unable to formulate any recommendations.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn G.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ate here last year for Valentine's day and had a fantastic experience.  I had seen it on Check, Please.  It is beautiful and the food and drinks were fantastic.  This is not a cheap place but for a romantic date night, it was wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely phenomenal.  We came with a party of six and ordered the chef's menu.  Everything was outstanding.  The kitchen was willing to accommodate a couple special requests.  There were two items on the menu we wanted to be sure we didn't miss.Spendy, yes, but well worth it.  Great atmosphere.  (You might not be able to tell from the lobby and bar, but the dining room, which is upstairs, is a lot of fun.)  Excellent, attentive service.  Outstanding food.  Definitely check it out for a special occasion and make reservations a couple weeks out.

Reviews.Author: Kurt N.
Reviews.Content: Everything from the appetizers to the flatbread was delicious but the suckling pig stole the show.  I'm not a big fan of brain but every other part of the pig was simple (seasoned with nothing more than some salt and drizzled with oil) and packed with flavor including the cheeks.  The restaurant reminded me of NYC.  As you walk in there is a small bar and a humble entrance but then you walk up the stairs to be seated and the actual restaurant is one giant room where the ceiling never comes into view surrounding you with a lively atmosphere.  Definitely a good change of pace from the typical chicago-style restaurants around town.  I would go there again.

Reviews.Author: Ryan B.
Reviews.Content: A fantastic environment and delightful cuisine.  Mercat is located inside the Blackstone Hotel - a terrific revival.  I've have only enjoyed lunch at Mercat, but will be back for dinner soon.  The pre fixe menu perfectly compliments all taste buds from savory to sweet.

Reviews.Author: Tony P.
Reviews.Content: We went here with 4 other friends, based on reviews from Yelp and other friends. Pros: Location (on Michigan Ave.), outdoor seating, nice upbeat ambience. The food was good - some dishes better than others. Try the mango sorbet - it has a spicy kick that I've never tasted before. Cons: overpriced. The portions are small, and the prices are inflated - even for a tapas place. Service was okay - they're busy, and the waiters seem to have their attention diverted. And, we were constantly rushed. The waiter even took my bill before I had placed my credit card inside the holder! Talk about hints. Overall: The place was 'meh, I've experienced better'. Worth trying, but not going back.

Reviews.Author: Anne K.
Reviews.Content: The food was really good. I like the bacon wrapped dates and the potatoes with paprika

Reviews.Author: Philip C.
Reviews.Content: You pay for the location and the name of the chef, not the food. The food was just ok. We got four or five tapas and a ribeye. It just wasn't all that great. I wouldn't eat here again. Atmosphere is great, service is ok, but the food is lacking.There are better options only a few steps away.

Reviews.Author: Brooke A.
Reviews.Content: yummy! I liked the food, every portion seemed just enough. It's a higher price point for tapas, and nothing really knocked me off my feet. I liked the decor and the service was ok... but nothing to write home about, which is why i gave them 4 stars rather than 5.

Reviews.Author: Keith O.
Reviews.Content: Went here for restaurant week so we were able to sample 3 courses for $22.  At that price it was a real steal.  The food was good, portions were big for a tapas restaurant but the were not huge.  We also had the white sangria which was perfect for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Glenn M.
Reviews.Content: Great food great service..excellent wine selection..

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: I hated this place. My bf and I meant our friends here for brunch since they made reservations here. At first walking in it was dead downstairs walked up the spiral/grand staircase and wad greeted by a hostess and sat at our table. The restaurant seemed to share the bathroom with starbucks and the hotel attached to it. Then our waiter was an older gentleman and he was a bit rude not sure if he was having a bad morning but he wasnt very attentive. Also the food was way over salted I kept drinking my water by the time we were done eating I was so bloated with water weight I felt sick.

Reviews.Author: Reg W.
Reviews.Content: over-rated.  In fairness, this review is for the dinner portion and I have not tried the brunch at this place yet.  The food was not memorable at all!

Reviews.Author: Trevor S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food! Beautiful dining room! Great service! This is a special restaurant that really does the whole 'small plate thing' really well.  Attention to detail and flavor are in every bite and after several visits here, I have yet to find anything not up to par.  I am not a seafood eater and the Chef always takes that into accomodation when creating my experience.  We go every year to celebrate our anniversary and enjoy a wonderful Cava and really celebrate a great meal...  This is a very authentic Catalan restaurant in a city that does'nt have many options in that genre.

Reviews.Author: Pecorino P.
Reviews.Content: Planned a surprise party for my hubby + 10 friends on a Friday night.  Everything was flawless.  Food was delicious, service was attentive but  not overbearing or nosey.  We cleaned up all the tapas / share plates & drank every last drop of sangria.  Deeeelish!  The atmosphere was perfect & lively!  So happy to have been recommended Mercat.  Thanks for a wonderful surprise birthday!!!  Looking forward to returning to enjoy brunch.

Reviews.Author: Boston L.
Reviews.Content: Everything we had was absolutely amazing. Service was excellent as well!

Reviews.Author: Narmina G.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!!  Really a pleasant, jazzy environment.  Really enjoyed the many tasty sangria options.  Imagine the food is so good, I've eaten there 3 times in 4 weeks, tapas here are insane !!!

Reviews.Author: Gina N.
Reviews.Content: Best mojito ever, and excellent service, but the food was only okay. There was nothing that blew me away for the price we were paying.

Reviews.Author: Raquel S.
Reviews.Content: Great food with a lounge atmosphere in the heart of Chicago.....

Reviews.Author: faline m.
Reviews.Content: The food is def 5 stars. unbelievably yummy!4 stars though because of the noise level, really too loud. also, why do they make it so hard to find the entrance?

Reviews.Author: Terris A.
Reviews.Content: We went there for their brunch and were pleasantly surprised for the price we paid, the quality of service and food.  Sometimes you go to places that are typical tourist spots, you get bad service and sub par food.  Not here.  Make your own bloody mary bar- awesome.  Every dish that came-yum.  The attendant at the cheese and meat bar- hilarious and really made our morning.

Reviews.Author: Mark L.
Reviews.Content: The food at this establishment was simply fantastic. A little more pricey than some of the other Chicago tapa staples, but more upscale and certiantly on par with the food.

Reviews.Author: Tia W.
Reviews.Content: Recently dined here for a business lunch and was really impressed. I will say that if you are new to tapas this may not be enjoyable or if you are a vegetarian. I ordered the Hangar Steak Sandwich and it was seasoned and cooked to perfection. I will definitely return to try the drink menu. Service was great as well.

Reviews.Author: Katie K.
Reviews.Content: First the positives: ambiance great (although a bit noisy - don't bring a job interview here), food outstanding.  Wide range of choices and interesting specials.  Quite pricey, even for downtown tapas, but we kind of expected that.  The big negative was the service.  Our waiter did not seem inexperienced, but he took the order without writing it down (which always causes some worry) and then, surprise, some of our items failed to show up.  Since we had some very specific preferences in the group and had ordered accordingly, this was a problem.  Since we live in the suburbs and are wedded to the train schedules, this was a bigger problem.  We waited an extra hour and took a later train in order to finally get my meatless meal, and the food was great, but we won't be returning here.

Reviews.Author: Kirsten H.
Reviews.Content: Decided to do the tasting menu. Some great dishes, although my one complaint was that a lot of bread was served with the dishes. Go easy on the bread, otherwise you won't have room for all the good stuff!

Reviews.Author: Garth G.
Reviews.Content: The food was absolutely amazing.  Tried this place twice while staying at the Chicago Hilton and it was amazing.  How you get Octopus that tender while grilling is unknown.  The portions are not huge but the food is excellent and the service good.

Reviews.Author: Tiff J.
Reviews.Content: I had my first visit at Mercat this past saturday. We made reservations for 8pm, we arrived ten minutes early and were told to wait at the bar until our table was ready, no biggie because we were ahead of schedule. We waited until about 8:10 and checked on our table. Still, not ready, and the hostess told us there was one table ahead of us. A table ahead of us?? We're not on the wait list. We have reservations which means there should be no one ahead of us since our reso was for 8pm and its 8:10. Clearly they were behind on wait times, but she didn't seem too apologetic, which was even more annoying. So back to the bar we went. I had some kiwi cocktail which was very refreshing! We sat at the bar until 8:40 when someone finally came to get us. On a positive note our server, wish I remembered his name, was pretty awesome. He knew the menu inside out and was efficient. We had a pitcher of sangria, which was delicious, and ordered 6 small plates: cheese mixto plate, jamon serrano, garlic shrimp, scallops, bacon wrapped lamb, and short ribs on flat bread. Each dish was amazing!...with the exception of the scallops, they fell a little flat, but still edible. For dessert we had chocolate and marshmallows. Sweet and just the right portion, little flavorful bites. Overall, the food was pretty good, but Mercat might want to have a talking to their hosts. If you're behind on times, communicate that. Don't make the guest feel as if its their problem. Maybe check on the guests a few times to reassure them you're working on their table. Apologize! The point of making a reservation is not to wait. 10 minutes, okay, 40 minutes is ridiculous. Mercat would definitely earn another star had this not been an issue.

Reviews.Author: Samantha R.
Reviews.Content: Came here one hot summer night for an anniversary dinner. We got some fantastic sangria-love that they offer several unique kinds. The small plates are super small and pretty pricey, but we really enjoyed what we ordered. The dessert was out of this world, house-made lemon cheesecake with blueberry ice cream. Service was friendly and attentive and the restaurant has great ambiance.

Reviews.Author: B B.
Reviews.Content: First, the four stars didn't quite get five due to price. The food is outstanding, but the prices are quite high.  I am visiting from out of town and have been to Mercat twice in four days. I might go again tomorrow before I leave if for nothing else than to have the mushrooms and red sangria. I don't know if I have ever had a mushroom dish that tasted so heavenly.  I tried the flight of sangria to see what they each tasted like. I prefer not-sweet, so the red was the winner for me. There were SAGE leaves in it! OMG, who would have thought that would be such a perfect flavor?!  The eggplant was also great.  The second night, I took two friends and we had a LOT of different dishes. I think the mushrooms were again my favorite, but the bacon wrapped dates with almond were incredible.  We shared a pitcher of red sangria and that was plenty for three of us. Friends said the scallops were wonderful and we all thought the rabbit was good. We tried different cheeses, octopus, and several other dishes. The patatas bravas were very tasty, but this dish was one where I really felt like the fancy presentation was what we paid for. Great food, and beautiful presentation, but the flavor should carry the dish and it felt almost pretentious for the small amount on the plate, no matter how beautiful it looked. If finances are not a problem, this is a terrific place to enjoy many different flavors. Every single bite of food was wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Louis L.
Reviews.Content: I hosted a corporate dinner here last week and it was perfect. The food was excellent and the staff made sure they did everything they could to make sure that we were taken care of. We had a private bar and the bartender always made sure everyone's glass had something in it. The food was quick to the table and tasted as amazing as it looked. Its a little hard to spot when your going down the street, maybe they should look at getting better signage out front but that's my only issue. Great place. You should go.

Reviews.Author: Kappa Y.
Reviews.Content: Very good although perhaps a little pricey if you walk in thinking tapa's.  The restaurant space is well done although if enter through the hotel it feels as if you are using a  staff entrance.  There is definitely a little excess in staff activity; however everyone was pleasant and prompt and attentive to my wife's food allergies.  We tried the tasting menu, which probably contributed to the cost however seemed the best way to really get a feel for what they were serving.  Some of the most memorable things, the salad w/ bacon and prosciutto (salty but good), the lamb, tuna,and spicy shrimp.  Sitting here writing this is exciting me to go back so I guess get on over there and try it!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: The food and service was superb!  Our server helped us with my wine selection and she was spot on!  All the dishes were wonderful and I can't wait to go back.  We didn't get the table we had wanted but that was the only flaw in evening.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Joe I.
Reviews.Content: Fine dining tapas experience. I recommend trying the duck, out of this world. Cool atmosphere (not too stuffy). Excellent service.

Reviews.Author: Lizzie R.
Reviews.Content: Mercat is a Super fun place to go with a large group!  Fabulous dining room!!!  They have a great set menu for a party of ten or more and its well worth it!!  The food is really good.  If you havent been I highly recommend it!  Great for birthday parties!

Reviews.Author: Christopher B.
Reviews.Content: Really quite good innovative tapas.  Great mix of quality traditional fare with fresh takes on old standards.  Highly recommended - especially if like me, you're tired of most of the Chicago tapas fare which is so-so at best.As far as comments on service, I'm baffled.  Maybe it's because they wore black put some folks off?  Our waiter was attentive and professional and made some genuinely good suggestions;  no posing at all.  I was also sensitive to this from other comments and every table nearby seemed to be having friendly, helpful service - back waiters not bad either...   I was also impressed that they seated us promptly at 9:00 on a Saturday evening.We had basic Jamon Serrano, Chorizo (both classics and well done) with the bacon-wrapped dates (very good).  The Barramundi was superb and the pork belly sublime.  The shellfish Croquettes were also a nice alternative to typically denser and heavier croquettes.  I also highly recommend the Catalan spinach which I wouldn't normally have ordered if not for the recommendation of the waiter - a nice surprise.  The Butifarra (homemade sausage) was deftly seasoned - piquant without being overpowering. To top it off, the chocolate Croquette dessert was really amazing.I also have to give Mercat credit for a substantive and moderately priced wine list offering many options by the glass, half carafe and larger, all at very reasonable prices.  The half-carafe option also let's you mix things up a bit and try various wines.Highly recommended.4/29/09 - Changed my vote to 5 stars after seeing Arco De Cuchilleros averaged to 4 stars rating.  in NO WAY should diners confuse the quality of the two....

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem.     Great Sangria and the weekend brunch is really  good.   On a nice day the outdoor seating is wnderful

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stopped by Mercat for dinner. We started at the bar and asked the bartender for her favorite spicy red wine. It was very good and went well with all the food we ended up getting. When it came time to eat, everything looked so good we couldn't decide so we had the waitress bring all of her favorites. Everything we had was delicious especially the bacon wrapped dates and chocolate dessert. Our first order of food was delivered to the wrong table (some of the servers seemed to be distracted by the presence of a former baseball player) but the waitress made up for it by buying us a round of drinks.

Reviews.Author: Ed W.
Reviews.Content: The location caught our attention (very close to the Chicago Auditorium) and the venue sealed the deal. Spanish tapas is a treat when it is done right -- and this is done right - for the most part. The gambas al ajillo - garlic shrimp was excellent. Sauce was bubbling on delivery and plenty of it soak up with the excellent bread that was served (ask for More bread - they accommodated us) The wine selection is good - but expect to pay over $60/bottle for something other than "cheap red wine" but maybe that is the wine snob in me talking. The beef short rib flatbread was disappointing in that it tasted like ordinary BBQ sauce - we were expecting something unusual. The shaved cauliflower salad was excellent - as were the bacon wrapped dates. The cheese was good - but they brought us the wrong selection -- we were trying to figure out how the walnuts turned to jelly - until wee realized we had jelly - no walnuts. We sat in the upper section which miffed us at first - no view - but the noise was less and we could talk easily.  We made our show - but were hungary later that night - such is the nature of tapas.  I'll go back for drinks at the bar to get the full atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Natasha M.
Reviews.Content: 5 Star for food and decor. 1 star taken for quantity.A restaurant for small stomach with a big wallet! This is probably the most RIDICULOUS restaurants Hungry Chicago has ever been to out of the 90 restaurants in Chicago in terms of quantity of food and price proportion. A tilapia that is smaller than half of your palm is $17. Five thin slices of duck is (size of your thumb/slice) is $16. All the dishes are ridiculously small. We have been there twice, and every time we saw people's eyes popping out when they saw the dishes. One couple sitting next to us actually ordered 3 dishes and only finished half of their think sliced steak plate, which is priced $48. We peaked at their bill and it's about $161. SO I am sure there are people appreciating the concept of  "fine dining" in the Mercat way. Of course, here is not the place to get full. It's just for an experience or small eats.If you want to impress your date with your wallet, here is the place to go. The atmosphere is unbelievably amazing, very modern, luxurious, classy and sexy!

Reviews.Author: Alan K.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is upbeat and restaurant is well designed.  The main dining area is two stories tall and overlooks Grant Park through giant windows.  Although its is part of the recently restored Blackstone Hotel, it is built out in a modern and simplistic fashion and has an open kitchen as well.  Service was great for the most part.  Our waiter was just ok; I had to ask about the specials and he took an eternity to bring the desert menus and our check.  That being said, the food came out promptly, dishes were warm when they were supposed to be, and not all at one time (which can be a problem with tapas).  The menu is not as expansive as some other tapas restaurants, but they more than made up for it with the high quality ingredients and unique dishes.  Tip: try the Serrano Ham and Fig Salad

Reviews.Author: Casey M.
Reviews.Content: The food was very "Iron Chef". Not my style (I am a meat and potatoes girl),but it was yummy. Lots of garlic and I love garlic. My tummy was happy,but my mental need for comfort food was not. Hubbie doesn't eat seafood,duck,or lamb,so our choices were slim,but what we ordered was good.

Reviews.Author: YULIA M.
Reviews.Content: Great place. The entrance was underwhelming, but upstairs is breathtaking huge hall, beautifully designed. The menu is very well thought through, all items on the plate really compliment each other. Almond gazpacho is incredible, as well as pork belly, pulpo con patatas, and olive oil cake with wild blueberries. The wine is really overpriced, although the selection is decent. I would bring my own the next time.

Reviews.Author: Scott C.
Reviews.Content: To those who complain about small portions: That is what Tapas is!! Very tasty stuff... we were there for Sunday lunch so they had the brunch menu, a smaller but heavily discounted menu. I agree with previous reviewers: the bacon wrapped dates are a very interesting dish! We also had the Spanish meat and cheese station... yummo (very very tasty goats cheese partnered wonderfully with Spanish Cabernet!)

Reviews.Author: Chirag P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing.

Reviews.Author: Andy V.
Reviews.Content: I thought Mercat a la Planxa was good at best. Although the food was delicious, I thought the service and management need severe help.  We arrived early for a 7:30 reservation and were told they could seat us earlier. By the time we were shown to our table it was 7:50. We wouldn't have cared if the bartender wasnt horrible. The bald asian bartender needs some serious help. Not only was he rude, he poured the weakest .75 ounce of tequilla ($13) I have ever had. Even the young hostess was  pathetic. At one point, another party complianed to her about the bartender and she just rolled her eyes. At our table we had a pleasant waitress who really didnt provide assistance with the menu. However,  the food quality was great. We are large foodies and ordered a wide assortment of the plates, which were all delicious.  We did have a manager come to our table to check on how things were going, but she showed up 2 minutes after we sat down. The waitress never checked on us until all of our plates were finished. Overall, I dont think we will rush back. I really liked the food but did not like the whole experience. For our party of four, we spent $250 and I would have appreciated a better experience. Even on our way out, another manager asked about our night. When we explained our issues, he rolled his eyes (they must teach that) and walked away. There are better restaurants in Chicago. I am really surprised by the number of positive reviews. They must not eat out often.

Reviews.Author: Lilian R.
Reviews.Content: Best tapas I have ever had in the us
